Package infodynamics.measures.continuous

Interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ChannelCalculatorCommon, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKernel, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov1, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2, MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKernel, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateSingleObservationsKernel, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo
    public interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
extends ChannelCalculatorCommon
    A basic interface for calculators computing measures on a multivariate channel from a source to a destination time-series (i.e. mutual information and transfer entropy). In the following, we refer to the abstract measure computed by this calculator as the "channel measure".

    This interface inherits from ChannelCalculatorCommon to make it specific to multivariate sources and destinations.

    Usage is as described by the paradigm for ChannelCalculatorCommon, but with:

    • A new initialise(int, int) method to specify the number of joint variables in the source and destination;
    • The abstract "setObservations" and "addObservations" references therein implemented in the setObservations(double[][], double[][]) and addObservations(double[][], double[][]) etc defined here for multiivariate series.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    ChannelCalculator

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        void initialise​(int sourceDimensions,
                int destDimensions)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialise the calculator for (re-)use, with the existing (or default) values of parameters, with number of source and destination joint variables specified. Clears an PDFs of previously supplied observations.
        Parameters:
        sourceDimensions - the number of joint variables in the source
        destDimensions - the number of joint variables in the destination
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        void setObservations​(double[][] source,
                     double[][] destination)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets a single series from which to compute the PDF for the channel measure. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        The supplied series are certainly (multivariate) time-series for time-series measures such as transfer entropy, however may be simply a set of separate observations for the mutual information without a time interpretation.

        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        void setObservations​(double[] source,
                     double[][] destination)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets a single series from which to compute the PDF for the channel measure -- available ONLY if sourceDimensions was initialised to 1. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        The supplied series are certainly (multivariate) time-series for time-series measures such as transfer entropy, however may be simply a set of separate observations for the mutual information without a time interpretation.

        Parameters:
        source - series of univariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        void setObservations​(double[][] source,
                     double[] destination)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets a single series from which to compute the PDF for the channel measure -- available ONLY if destDimensions was initialised to 1. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        The supplied series are certainly (multivariate) time-series for time-series measures such as transfer entropy, however may be simply a set of separate observations for the mutual information without a time interpretation.

        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of univariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        void setObservations​(double[] source,
                     double[] destination)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets a single pair of univariate series from which to compute the PDF for the channel measure -- available ONLY if both sourceDimensions and destDimensions were initialised to 1. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        The supplied series are certainly time-series for time-series measures such as transfer entropy, however may be simply a set of separate observations for the mutual information without a time interpretation.

        Design note: this method is defined here in addition to in ChannelCalculator rather than only in ChannelCalculatorCommon since ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator etc inherit directly from ChannelCalculatorCommon but this method would not be relevant for them.

        Parameters:
        source - series of observations for the source variable.
        destination - series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if sourceDimensions and destDimensions were not both initialised to 1 in initialise(int, int)

      • addObservations

        void addObservations​(double[][] source,
                     double[][] destination)
              throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        void addObservations​(double[] source,
                     double[][] destination)
              throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Available ONLY if sourceDimensions was initialised to 1. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Parameters:
        source - series of uniivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        void addObservations​(double[][] source,
                     double[] destination)
              throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Available ONLY if destDimensions was initialised to 1. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        destination - series of uniivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        void addObservations​(double[] source,
                     double[] destination)
              throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new set of univariate observations to update the PDFs with. available ONLY if both sourceDimensions and destDimensions were initialised to 1. It is intended to be called multiple times, and must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(). Call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Design note: this method is defined here in addition to in ChannelCalculator rather than only in ChannelCalculatorCommon since ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator etc inherit directly from ChannelCalculatorCommon but this method would not be relevant for them.

        Parameters:
        source - series of observations for the source variable.
        destination - series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if sourceDimensions and destDimensions were not both initialised to 1 in initialise(int, int)

      • addObservations

        void addObservations​(double[][] source,
                     double[][] destination,
                     int startTime,
                     int numTimeSteps)
              throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new sub-series of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        startTime - first index to take observations on
        numTimeSteps - number of steps from and including startTime to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        void setObservations​(double[][] source,
                     double[][] destination,
                     boolean[] sourceValid,
                     boolean[] destValid)
              throws java.lang.Exception

        Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from, where the source and destination observations are valid. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        The supplied series are certainly time-series for time-series measures such as transfer entropy, however may be simply a set of separate observations for the mutual information without a time interpretation.

        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        sourceValid - series (with first indices the same as source) indicating whether the source at that index is valid.
        destValid - time series (with first indices the same as destination) indicating whether the destination at that index is valid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        void setObservations​(double[][] source,
                     double[][] destination,
                     boolean[][] sourceValid,
                     boolean[][] destValid)
              throws java.lang.Exception

        Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from, where the source and destination observations are valid for all joint variables. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.

        Parameters:
        source - series of multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        destination - series of multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number). Length must match source, and their indices must correspond.
        sourceValid - series (with indices the same as source) indicating whether each variable of the source at that index is valid.
        destValid - time series (with indices the same as destination) indicating whether each variable of the destination at that index is valid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations​(double[][] newSourceObservations,
                                               double[][] newDestObservations)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the local measure values for each of the supplied samples in newSourceObservations and newDestObservations.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in newSourceObservations and newDestObservations (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).

        Parameters:
        newSourceObservations - series of observations for the source variable (indexed by time or observation index then variable number)
        newDestObservations - series of observations for the destination variable (indexed by time or observation index then variable number) Length must match newSourceObservations, and their indices must correspond.
        Returns:
        the series of local channel measure values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
